All videos in the vault are now mobile friendly!

18 5-Star Reviews: THANK YOU!!!

Here's What You'll Get In The Ninja Blog Secrets Members Training Vault: You Get Me! Every Class. Every Video.

I'm Evan Kopelson, creator of this site and 'Sensei' (teacher) of Ninja Blog Secrets. I'll be your guide in every class of this video training course, and you'll be watching me 'click by click' as I build a professional WordPress site, setup my blog, and integrate it with powerful online tools. I go at a nice, slow pace and explain everything as I'm doing it, so it'll be easy for you even if you are new online.

Check out the description of the course modules below and read some of my client's reviews. You can even watch the first 4 videos, my entire Pre-Orientation Module, absolutely free. That is a full hour of content, free!

You can get the course right here on this page. Just look for that blue button on the top right that says "Take This Course."

Click the blue button, make your payment, and I'll see you in class!

-Evan, Your Sensei for Ninja Blog Secrets

------ Client Review -----

Fanta-bulous resource!

I should have seen these video sessions long back. Evan Kopelson is indeed a master when it comes to Wordpress. I'm still half-way and I have already gained a tremendous insight into things which I have never thought about. Will update the review once I complete the course.

-by Knowledge Decoded! Shameer Mohammed

----- Client Review -----

Amazing course.

I already have installed wp on a couple of websites. I'm self taught and I had the idea that if my website loads on a browser, this was enough. Yet, I wasn't happy. Wordpress is really user friendly if you just want to post something quick online, but watching Evan starting from scratch really taught me I was doing many things the wrong way. From setting up email accounts, to how to choose a host, and get a domain with a different company so you may be able to get the best deal. Evan also goes over what are the pros and cons of all the available settings and plugins that wordpress has available. I already finished the class, but I find myself revisiting many of the lectures because the information and advice is really valuable. Evan also makes the videos entertaining, and easy to understand. I enjoyed learning a lot from this course :)

-Erick Sandoval

----- Course Outline -----

Module 0 – Orientation I'll welcome you and tell you a little about what to expect in Orientation Class. Module 1 – Domains I'll show you how to get your own domains in Classes 1 and 2. Module 2 – Web Hosting I'll get you through all the technical stuff with your hosting account in Classes 3-7. Module 3 – Custom Email Addresses In Classes 8-12, I'll show you how to setup email addresses at your domain. Module 4 – WordPress, Themes, and Settings In Classes 14-23 you'll learn to install WordPress, pick a theme & configure settings. Module 5 – WordPress Plugins I'll show you how to soup up your blog's power with plugins in Classes 24-34. Module 6 – Personal Branding and Social Media In Classes 35-37 I'll show you how to brand your blog and integrate it with social media. Module 7 – Creating Content You'll learn how to create pages, posts, and so much more in Classes 38-44. Module 8 – Driving Traffic I'll show you different ways to drive traffic to your blog in Classes 45-47. Module 9 – WordPress Menus In Class 48, I'll show you how to setup custom menus in WordPress. Module 10 – Video Blogging In Classes 49 and 50, I'll show you the secrets to embedding video on your blog. Free Course Updates for Life When I update the members vault and add new videos, you'll get them free.

-----

How Long Will This Course Take to Get Through?

Depending how motivated you are to complete the course, you can finish it in a weekend or spread it out over the course of a week or more. Each class runs between 3 minutes and 30 minutes. There are very few classes over 30 minutes long. A lot of the longer classes isn't harder work, it's just me explaining things carefully and going extra slowly so you won't get left behind if you're not totally comfortable with computers. It's up to you how long to take.
